install_guide_markdown:
# Ubuntu Studio 24.04 LTS Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 4 GB RAM minimum (8 GB+ recommended for production)
- 40 GB free disk space (100 GB+ for media projects)
- USB drive (8 GB+) for bootable media
- Audio interface (optional but recommended)

## Step 1: Download and Verify ISO
Download from official Ubuntu Studio mirrors.

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use tools like Rufus (Windows), Etcher (cross-platform), or dd (Linux).

## Step 3: Boot from USB
Restart computer and access boot menu.

## Step 4: Install Ubuntu Studio
Follow graphical installer, similar to Ubuntu installation.

## Step 5: Post-Installation
Configure audio with JACK, explore pre-installed creative applications (Ardour, GIMP, Blender, Kdenlive).

install_steps.title: Download Ubuntu Studio ISO
install_steps.detail_md:
Download Ubuntu Studio 24.04 LTS from the official website.

**DVD ISO**: 4.8 GB (includes all multimedia applications)  

Ubuntu Studio is pre-configured for audio, video, and graphics production.

install_steps.title: Verify ISO Checksum
install_steps.detail_md: Verify the downloaded ISO using SHA256 checksum to ensure file integrity and authenticity.

commands.explanation: PowerShell command to compute SHA256 hash
Linux command to verify SHA256 checksum

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md:
Use a USB drive (8 GB or larger) to create bootable installation media.

**Windows**: Use Rufus or Etcher  
**Linux**: Use `dd` command or Startup Disk Creator  

**WARNING**: This will erase all data on the USB drive.

install_steps.title: Boot from USB Drive
install_steps.detail_md:
Insert USB drive and restart your computer. Access boot menu (usually F12, F2, ESC, or DEL during startup).

Select the USB drive to boot Ubuntu Studio installer.

install_steps.title: Install Ubuntu Studio
install_steps.detail_md:
Click "Install Ubuntu Studio" icon.

Follow Ubiquity installer prompts:
- Select language and keyboard layout
- Choose installation type (normal or minimal)
- Select disk and partition scheme
- Create user account
- Wait for installation to complete

install_steps.title: Configure Audio System
install_steps.detail_md:
Ubuntu Studio comes with JACK Audio Connection Kit pre-installed.

Configure audio settings using Ubuntu Studio Controls:
- Select your audio interface
- Configure buffer size and sample rate
- Set up JACK for low-latency audio

Test with included applications like Ardour.

description: Ubuntu Studio is an official Ubuntu flavor designed for multimedia production: audio recording/editing, video production, graphics design, and photography. Comes with a complete suite of creative applications.
long_description: Ubuntu Studio is the official Ubuntu flavor for creative content production. It's specifically configured for audio, video, graphics, photography, and publishing work. The distribution features a low-latency kernel optimized for real-time audio processing, KDE Plasma desktop environment, and JACK Audio Connection Kit for professional audio routing. Ubuntu Studio comes pre-installed with a comprehensive collection of creative software including Ardour (DAW), Audacity, Blender (3D), GIMP (image editing), Inkscape (vector graphics), Kdenlive (video editing), and many more tools. The installation is larger than standard Ubuntu because it includes this complete multimedia production suite. It's ideal for musicians, producers, video editors, graphic designers, and photographers who want a ready-to-use creative workstation.
